meanings.definition: In a rude or abrupt manner, without any formalities or courtesy.
meanings.sent1: She left unceremoniously, slamming the door behind her.
meanings.sent2: The boss unceremoniously fired the employee without warning.
meanings.sent3: The cat unceremoniously knocked over the vase, then sauntered away.
meanings.sent4: The storm unceremoniously swept through the town, leaving chaos in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The magician unceremoniously pulled a rabbit out of the hat, surprising the audience.

meanings.definition: Without any ceremony or formalities; abruptly or rudely.
meanings.sent1: He unceremoniously dropped the mic after his performance.
meanings.sent2: The guest unceremoniously left the party without saying goodbye.
meanings.sent3: The toddler unceremoniously threw his toys out of the crib.
meanings.sent4: The car unceremoniously broke down in the middle of the highway.
meanings.sent5: The student unceremoniously handed in his incomplete assignment, hoping for leniency.
